allowedAttestationTitles(string).details: Checks if a title is allowed to be attested.

allowedSchemas(bytes32).details: Checks which action a role can perform on a schema.

cannotReply(bytes32).details: Validates if an attestation can have a response.

params.eas: The address of the global EAS contract.

returns._0: An array of all attestation titles.

getRoleAdmin(bytes32).details: Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}.

grantRole(bytes32,address).details: Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleGranted} event.

returns._0: Whether the resolver supports ETH transfers.

renounceRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been revoked `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `callerConfirmation`. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

params.attestation: The existing attestation to be revoked.

returns._0: Whether the attestation can be revoked.

revokeRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

setAttestationTitle(string,bool).details: Sets the attestation for a given title that will be attested. When creating attestions, the title must match to the desired configuration saved on the resolver.

params.isValid: Whether the title for the attestation is valid or not. Defaults to false.
params.title: The title of the attestation.

setSchema(bytes32,uint256).details: Sets the action ID that schema can perform. The schema determines the data layout for the attestation, while the attestation determines the data that will fill the schema data.

params.action: The action that the role can perform on the schema.

attest((bytes32,bytes32,uint64,uint64,ui.notice: Processes an attestation and verifies whether it's valid.

getAllAttestationTitles().notice: This function will retrieve all titles allowed in the resolver. It was designed to aid the frontend in displaying the current badges available. NOTE: Only the badges marked as valid will be returned.

isPayable().notice: Checks if the resolver can be sent ETH.

revoke((bytes32,bytes32,uint64,uint64,ui.notice: Processes an attestation revocation and verifies if it can be revoked.
